resources.string:
The game is ten rounds long and you have three throws each round. You may save dice that should not be rolled the next throw, to save a die you press it and it will be marked grey.
 You have ten different score options to choose from, you may choose one score option each round and after an option has been selected it can not be selected again that game. 

 The scoring works as such that the dice you have selected must sum up to the chosen value and will grant that value as points, for example if you have marked the dice 5, 4, 5, 4, 3, 6, and you choose Nine(9) you will be granted 27 points. 

 NOTE! When a die is saved it will also be marked for scoring, the game will count the dice in the order you have selected them so make sure to select the dice in correct order.

To score you have to select the dice that you want and then choose the appropriate score option. 

For example if you have marked the dice 5, 4, 5, 4, 3, 6, and you choose Nine(9) you will be granted 27 points. 

 NOTE!
 When a die is saved (marked grey) it will also be marked for scoring.
 The game will count the dice in the order you have selected them so make sure to select the dice in correct order.
